data: GENSURG Whipple-Pancreatectomy (Enhanced Recovery After Surgery - ERAS) - Post Operative (Multiphase
Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the inpatient unit

QID before food and bedtime, Upon arrival to PACU

If urinary output is less than 100 mL per 4 hours
T+2;0600, On post-op day 2 (even if epidural in situ)
PRN, After removing Foley, patient to void at intervals no greater than 6 hours; measure post void residuals x 2 and PRN
If PVR greater than 400 mL, PRN, Repeat up to 2 times. If third catheterization is required, leave catheter in place and inform MD / NP. Inform MD / NP in AM if this occurs at night

Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
See ERAS Clinical Pathway for discharge criteria
Patient going home on pantoprazole 40 mg PO daily. Nurse to provide medication teaching sheet (Proton Pump Inhibitors)

Patient going home on Low Molecular Weight Heparin (enoxaparin or dalteparin). Discharge prescription may be for either enoxaparin or dalteparin for total duration of 28 days from start date of LMWH in hospital
Patient / family to be taught how to inject using LMWH (enoxaparin or dalteparin) (start post-op day 2) and to be given sharps container and appropriate teaching sheet
Patient / family member may administer LMWH (enoxaparin or dalteparin) while in hospital
q1h for 2 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h for 24 hour, post-op day 1, then q8h for 24 hour, post-op day 2, then q12h for 24 hour, post-op day 3, then qdaily until discharge
